Title:
Towards a natural classification of Botryosphaeriaceae: a
type study of Botryosphaeria sensu lato
Keywords:
Botryosphaeriales, phylogeny, sexual stage, taxonomy, type
specimens
Abstract:
The genus Botryosphaeria comprises more than 200 epithets,
but only type species B. dothidea and other ten species have been
identified based on DNA sequences. The taxonomic status of other taxa
has thus far been unconfirmed because of a lack of either morphological
information or DNA data. In this study, type or authentic specimens of
20 “Botryosphaeria” species had been obtained and were reassessed in
order to establish their correct identity and phylogenetic status. DNA
sequences of four nuclear loci, namely ITS, LSU, tef1-α and TUB, were
analysed and combined with the morphological features of the cultures
and conidia. Based on both the multigene phylogeny and morphological
characters, Botryosphaeria cruenta, B. dasylirii, B. hamamelidis, B.
ribis f. achromogena and B. wisteriae were transferred to Neofusicoccum,
while the generic status of B. aterrima, B. berengeriana var. weigelae
and B. mirabile within Botryosphaeria was confirmed, and B. berengeriana
var. acerina was renamed as B. acerina. B. aterrima, B. berengeriana
var. weigelae and B. mirabile were accepted within Botryosphaeria, and
B. berengeriana var. acerina was renamed as B. acerina. Botryosphaeria
minuscula was transferred to Lasiodiplodia as L. minuscula, and
Botryosphaeria mucosa to Neodeightonia as N. mucosa, Botryosphaeria
macrolopha to Gibberella as G. macrolopha and Botryosphaeria ferruginea
to Leptosphaerulina as L. ferruginea. B. foliicola was reduced to a
synonym with Phyllachorella micheliae. B. abuensis, B. aesculi and B.
bidwellii are treated as species of Botryosphaeriales incertae sedis,
and B. apocyni, B. gaubae and B. smilacinina as species of
Dothieomycetes incertae sedis.
